page.title: 10KILLINGHALL VILLAGE
page.content: Originally{Killinghall}was a rural farming area with almost everyone working on or in support of the farms - milling, blacksmiths, etc. At this time there were few houses, a church, a pub and two shops. As better transport opened up the village it developed to its' present size and now only eigth farms own all the agricultural land in the area. It has changed to a dormitory village for commuters very few residents working here. They are either retired or travel to Leeds, Harrogate, or Ripon. Five small housing estates have increased the size of the village and altered its' character. A community centre has been built as well as a nursing home and two sports fields, three shops and a public house.
